Name: Strong individual admin identities with MFA
Intent: Eliminate shared/root accounts and enforce MFA for all privileged access.
AWS: Root locked; SSO roles; IAM deny admin without MFA.
Azure: AAD + Conditional Access; PIM for privileged roles.
GCP: Cloud Identity; MFA via Context-Aware Access; org policy on keys.
PaC_Hook: Fail if admin user/role lacks MFA condition or root has active keys.

Name: Just-in-time privileged access
Intent: Avoid standing admin privileges; reduce insider and compromise risk.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.15/A.5.18; NIST AC-2/AC-6; BSI ORP.4; GDPR Art.25/32
AWS: Time-boxed roles via IAM Identity Center.
PaC_Hook: Fail if ADMIN roles attached permanently outside approved JIT mechanisms.

Name: Least-privilege workload identities
Intent: Ensure service identities have minimal necessary permissions.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.18/A.8.2; NIST AC-3/AC-6; BSI SYS.1.1; GDPR Art.25/32
AWS: IAM roles for compute; block *:* policies.
GCP: Scoped service accounts; disable user-managed keys.
PaC_Hook: Fail on *:* policies or disallowed service account keys.

Name: Centralised identity federation
Intent: Avoid local siloed admin accounts; enforce central IdP.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.17/A.8.2; NIST AC-2/IA-8; BSI ORP.1/ORP.4
AWS: SSO/SAML for humans; no standalone IAM users.
Azure: AAD as IdP; no local users on subscriptions.
GCP: Cloud Identity federation; no unmanaged admins.
PaC_Hook: Fail if human IAM user exists outside SSO boundary.

Name: Service account and credential lifecycle
Intent: Prevent orphaned, stale or unmanaged credentials.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.16/A.8.3; NIST IA-5; BSI CON.3; GDPR Art.32
Azure: Key Vault with rotation; managed identities.
GCP: Secret Manager; key rotation; disable legacy keys.
PaC_Hook: Fail if key age > N days or creds missing owner/rotation.

Name: No direct public management plane access
Intent: Block public exposure of admin interfaces.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.13/A.8.20; NIST AC-17/SC-7; BSI NET.*; GDPR Art.32
AWS: No SSH/RDP from internet; SSM/bastions only.
GCP: IAP; Private Service Connect; no public admin IPs.
PaC_Hook: Fail if admin ports open to 0.0.0.0/0.

Name: Default-deny inbound with segmented tiers
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.20; NIST SC-7; BSI NET.1.1/NET.3
PaC_Hook: Fail if wide-open inbound rules exist beyond whitelist.

Name: Controlled egress and DNS logging
Intent: Avoid uncontrolled outbound traffic, ensure DNS visibility.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.20/A.8.23; NIST SC-7/SI-4; BSI NET.*, DET.*
AWS: Central DNS resolvers; VPC egress controls.
GCP: Cloud DNS logs; egress firewall policies.
PaC_Hook: Fail if DNS not via approved resolvers or egress is any-any.

Name: Encryption at rest with central key management
Intent: Encrypt all persistent data with governed keys.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.24/A.8.25; NIST SC-12/SC-28; BSI CON.*; GDPR Art.32
Azure: Disk/DB/Storage encryption with Key Vault keys.
PaC_Hook: Fail if unencrypted storage or disallowed key policy found.

Name: Encryption in transit and secure endpoints
Intent: Ensure TLS-only access using modern protocols.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.21; NIST SC-8; GDPR Art.32
PaC_Hook: Fail on HTTP-only endpoints or weak TLS versions.

Name: Data classification and region constraints
Intent: Match regions to classification and residency rules.
PaC_Hook: Fail if classified data resources in non-approved region.

Name: Mandatory audit logging per account/subscription/project
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.15/A.8.16; NIST AU-2/AU-6; BSI DET.*; GDPR Art.5(2)
Azure: Activity Logs + Diagnostics to Log Analytics.
GCP: Admin/Data Access logs to central project.
PaC_Hook: Fail if no org-level audit trail or no export configured.

Name: Central log retention and integrity
Intent: Preserve logs with sufficient retention and immutability.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.15/A.8.17; NIST AU-9/AU-11; BSI LOG.*
AWS: Log buckets with retention + object lock.
Azure: Log Analytics retention and immutable storage.
PaC_Hook: Fail if retention below policy or logs deletable by admins.

Name: Guardrail violation alerting
Intent: Trigger timely triage when policies are breached.
PaC_Hook: Fail if critical policies have no bound alert rules.

Name: Approved hardened images and baselines
Intent: Reduce vulnerability and config drift via golden images.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.9/A.8.10; NIST CM-2/CM-6; BSI SYS.*
Azure: Shared Image Gallery; Azure Policy baselines.
PaC_Hook: Fail if workloads use non-approved images.

Name: Only approved services in sensitive environments
Intent: Limit attack surface to well-understood services.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.10/A.5.11; NIST CM-7; BSI OPS.*
Azure: Azure Policy to restrict resource types.
PaC_Hook: Fail if disallowed services detected in scope.

Name: Changes via approved IaC pipeline
Standards: ISO 27001 A.8.32/A.8.33; NIST CM-3/CM-5; BSI OPS.*
Azure: Bicep/ARM via CI/CD; deny direct edits.
PaC_Hook: Flag unmanaged resources or frequent console-only changes.

Name: Structured exception workflow
Intent: Allow risk-based deviations with full accountability.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.31/A.5.36; NIST RA-3; BSI ORP.*
AWS: Exceptions recorded with tags + ticket IDs.
Azure: Policy exemptions tied to work items.
GCP: Policy exceptions tracked via labels and registry.
PaC_Hook: Treat violation as hard-fail if no valid exception metadata.

Name: Evidence catalogue and machine-readable mapping
Intent: Link each guardrail to controls and concrete evidence artifacts.
Standards: ISO 27001 A.5.2/A.5.9; NIST CA-2/CA-7; GDPR Art.5(2)
AWS: Export PaC results and CloudTrail/Config metadata.
GCP: Policy Controller/Config Validator results, audit logs.
PaC_Hook: Regular export of policy evaluations into OSCAL-style or similar schema.
